titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Photographs of Brooklyn celebrities V1987.013
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T14:38-0500

physdesc.extent: six items contained in one folder.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for the photographs have not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Photographs of Brooklyn celebrities collection is comprised of six black-and-white photographic prints of celebrities who were born in Brooklyn. All photographs are 8 x 10 portraits (commonly referred to as head shots) of the following people: Elliot Gould, Connie Stevens, Brenda Vaccaro, James Farentino, Gabe Kaplan, and Dom DeLuise.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Photographs of Brooklyn celebrities, V1987.013, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1987.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.
